newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -FTSE to test 4,980 then may regain 5,000.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -FTSE to test 4,980 then may regain 5,000.

text.p: An unsettled session is expected on Friday, with the FTSE 100 index possibly trying to regain its place above the 5,000 level, but only after testing the region around 4,970-4,980 first, technical analysts said.
Bank shares will try to hold steady, while pharmaceuticals will probably halt their recent slide, they added.
By 0725 GMT, the FTSE was indicated down 4.4 at 4,986.9.

Over the past few days, the market has been hopping about, jumping up at some stage only to drop back again in a chaotic and haphazard manner. These have become shorter as the market began to lose form and indicate a weak overall trend developing.
But a sharp fall in share prices has usually been met by bargain hunters who have been eagerly waiting for a setback and this should cushion any fall in the FTSE today.
Although sellers have had the winning hand so far this week and have driven the FTSE below its 10-day moving average -- which is currently at 5,009 -- the downward pressure appears to be waning.
But buyers and sellers do not appear ready to yield too much and this stalemate should result in yet another erratic day from the index.
